intro: Randia pycnantha, commonly known as the small-flowered randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Randia pycnantha is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and continuous flowering habit.
